Package elements

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
elements.Camera
public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
Class Camera represents the camera in the scene.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Camera​(Point3D _p0, Vector _vTo, Vector _vUp)
    constructor for camera that receives the point where camera is located, vUp, and vTowards, and creates vRight by cross product of both vectors

  • Method Summary

    Receives pixel coordinates and constructs a beam of rays through it.

  • Constructor Details

    • Camera

      public Camera​(Point3D _p0, Vector _vTo, Vector _vUp)
      constructor for camera that receives the point where camera is located, vUp, and vTowards, and creates vRight by cross product of both vectors
      Parameters:
      _p0 - camera's location
      _vTo - vector from the camera towards scene
      _vUp - vector from camera upwards

  • Method Details

    • get_p0

      public Point3D get_p0()
      Returns:
      the point where camera is located

      Returns:
      vector vUp

    • constructRayThroughPixel

      public Ray constructRayThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, double screenDistance, double screenWidth, double screenHeight)
      Receives pixel coordinates and constructs a ray through it.
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels in X axis
      nY - number of pixels in Y axis
      j - j coordinate of pixel
      i - i coordinate of pixel
      screenDistance - distance of screen from camera
      screenWidth - screen width
      screenHeight - screen height
      Returns:
      ray through receives pixel

    • constructRaysThroughPixel

      public java.util.List<Ray> constructRaysThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, double screenDistance, double screenWidth, double screenHeight, int num_of_sample_rays)
      Receives pixel coordinates and constructs a beam of rays through it. This method is used for super sampling. Creating a beam of rays allows a more exact calculation of the color of the pixel.
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels in X axis
      nY - number of pixels in Y axis
      j - j coordinate of pixel
      i - i coordinate of pixel
      screenDistance - distance of screen from camera
      screenWidth - screen width
      screenHeight - screen height
      num_of_sample_rays - number of sample rays required
      Returns:
      beam of rays through receives pixel
